text: The Las Vegas Philharmonic is an American symphony orchestra, based in Las Vegas, Nevada. It was founded in 1998The Las Vegas Sun. www.lasvegassun.com. Retrieved on 2013-11-24. by Music Director and Conductor Laureate Harold Leighton Weller and long-time Las Vegas arts supporters Susan TompkinsSusan Tompkin's LinkedIn and Andrew Tompkins.The Las Vegas Philharmonic: About . lvphil.org. Retrieved on 2013-11-24. Since October 2012, the Las Vegas Philharmonic has been based at the Smith Center for the Performing Arts. Before then, it was based at Artemus W. Ham Concert Hall on the campus of the University of Nevada, Las Vegas. Nine guest conductors led the orchestra through the 2012-2013 season, each auditioning for the position of principal conductor.http://www.lvrj.com/neon/las-vegas-philharmonic-orchestra-starts- season-on-joyful-note-175171421.html?login=y Las Vegas Philharmonic is sometimes referred to as Las Vegas Philharmonic Orchestra. ==Principal conductors== {| |- |valign="top"| * 1998–2007 Harold Leighton Weller * 2007-2014 David Itkin * 2014–present Donato Cabrera |} ==External links== * Official website ==References== Category:Musical groups established in 1998 Category:Articles needing audio and or video Category:Symphony orchestra articles needing audio and or video Category:Performing arts in Nevada Category:Musical groups from Nevada Category:American orchestras Category:Las Vegas shows
title: Las Vegas Philharmonic Orchestra
